fields.headline: Mutu signs for Juventus
fields.bodyText: Adrian Mutu has signed a five-year contract with Juventus two months after being sacked by Chelsea and suspended from football for seven months by the Football Association for using cocaine. The ban will expire on May 18, meaning the 26-year-old forward will be able to play only the last two games of the current Serie A campaign. After the suspension the Romanian international said that he was considering quitting football. "Chelsea have destroyed me," he said then. "Now my career is in ruins. I might as well walk away from football." He dispensed with his agents Gica Popescu and Giovani Becali and signed a deal with an Italian management company led by Alessandro Moggi, the son of the Juventus managing director Luciano Moggi. Last month Mutu decided to start a rehabilitation programme and will be personally mentored by the former Arsenal defender Tony Adams.
